meanings.definition: To prescribe (a drug) in too large a quantity or dose.
meanings.sent1: The doctor should not overprescribe antibiotics for a simple cold.
meanings.sent2: It is important for healthcare providers not to overprescribe medication to avoid harmful side effects.
meanings.sent3: The pharmacist joked that he would overprescribe vitamins if he could.
meanings.sent4: She tends to overprescribe rest as the solution to every problem.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of overprescribing painkillers can be severe.

meanings.definition: To prescribe (a drug) unnecessarily or inappropriately.
meanings.sent1: The psychiatrist must not overprescribe medication without proper evaluation.
meanings.sent2: Doctors should be cautious not to overprescribe sleeping pills to patients.
meanings.sent3: The nurse accidentally overprescribed cough syrup to the patient, causing a sticky situation.
meanings.sent4: He tends to overprescribe exercise as the cure for all ailments.
meanings.sent5: Overprescribing antibiotics can lead to antibiotic resistance in the long run.
